messages.content:
DataSource.Error: ODBC: ERROR [HY000] [MySQL][ODBC 8.0(a) Driver]Can't connect to MySQL server on '35.224.49.90:3306' (10060)
ERROR [HY000] [MySQL][ODBC 8.0(a) Driver]Can't connect to MySQL server on '35.224.49.90:3306' (10060)
Detalles:
    DataSourceKind=Odbc
    DataSourcePath=dsn=ANDRES
    OdbcErrors=[Table]

Unfortunately, the error message indicates that the ODBC driver is unable to connect to the MySQL server at the specified IP address and port. There could be various reasons for this, such as incorrect credentials, network connectivity issues, firewall settings, or a problem with the MySQL server itself. 

Here are some steps you can try to troubleshoot the issue:

1. Verify that the IP address and port number are correct. You may want to double-check with your database administrator or hosting provider to ensure you have the right connection details.

2. Check that the MySQL server is up and running. You can try to ping the server from your local machine to confirm that it's accessible. You can also ask your database administrator to check the server logs for any errors or issues.

3. Ensure that you have the necessary permissions to access the database. Make sure that your credentials are correct and that you have been granted the appropriate level of access to the database and its tables.

4. Check if there are any firewall or network restrictions that might be blocking the connection. You may want to temporarily disable any firewalls or security software to see if that resolves the issue. Alternatively, you can try connecting from a different network or machine to isolate the problem.

5. Finally, you can try updating the ODBC driver to the latest version or reinstalling it to see if that resolves the issue.

If none of these steps resolve the issue, it may be helpful to consult with a database or network specialist who can assist with troubleshooting and resolving the problem.
A table of multiple values was supplied where a single value was expected.

This error message typically occurs when you try to insert or update data in a database table, and the value you're trying to insert/update is not compatible with the underlying data type of the column. 

For example, if you're trying to insert a string value into an integer column, or if you're trying to insert multiple values into a column that only supports a single value.

To resolve this error, you should review your data and compare it to the expected data types for each column in the table. Ensure that the data you're trying to insert or update is correct for the corresponding data type. 

You may also want to review the syntax of your SQL statement, particularly if you're trying to insert or update multiple rows at once. Make sure that the structure of your statement matches the structure of the table you're trying to manipulate.

If you're still having trouble, you may want to consult with a database expert or review the documentation for the specific database management system you're using to determine the cause of the error.
como crear una lista desplegable en excel

Para crear una lista desplegable en Excel, sigue estos pasos:

1. Selecciona la celda donde deseas crear la lista desplegable.
2. Haz clic en la pestaña "Datos" en la parte superior de la pantalla.
3. En el grupo "Herramientas de datos", selecciona "Validación de datos".
4. En la ventana "Configuración de validación de datos", elige "Lista" en la sección "Permitir".
5. En la sección "Origen", escribe o selecciona los elementos de la lista que quieres incluir separados por coma. Por ejemplo, si quieres incluir los elementos "Manzana", "Banana" y "Naranja", escribe "Manzana,Banana,Naranja".
6. Opcionalmente, puedes cambiar la configuración de Error Alert o Input Message según tus necesidades.
7. Haz clic en "Aceptar".

Una vez que hayas completado estos pasos, tendrás una lista desplegable en la celda seleccionada. Al hacer clic en la flecha hacia abajo en la celda, se mostrarán los elementos de la lista para que puedas seleccionar uno de ellos. Esta es una buena manera de asegurarte de que los datos se ingresen de manera consistente y sin errores.

"Laundry" es una palabra en inglés que significa "lavandería" en español. Por lo general, se utiliza para referirse a un lugar donde se lavan y secan prendas, toallas, sábanas, etc., ya sea un negocio comercial o una instalación en casa.

En una lavandería comercial, a menudo hay varias máquinas de lavado y secado disponibles para que los clientes las utilicen, junto con una máquina expendedora de detergente y suavizante. En algunos casos, también se ofrece servicio de planchado o limpieza en seco.

En una instalación de lavandería en casa, normalmente se utiliza una lavadora y una secadora para lavar y secar la ropa. En muchos hogares, la lavadora y la secadora se encuentran en la misma unidad o se colocan una al lado de la otra en una habitación designada para el lavado y secado de la ropa.
